info.headline: Heat Advisory issued July 20 at 2:23AM MDT until July 20 at 8:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...HEAT ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO 8 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Temperatures will reach the low 100`s in the the San Juan valley near Farmington and also in the middle Rio Grande valley including the Albuquerque metro area. Temperatures will be even hotter in the Chaves county plains, reaching up to 106 degrees near Roswell. * WHERE...Middle Rio Grande Valley including the Albuquerque Metro Area, Northwest Plateau, and Chaves County Plains. * WHEN...From Noon today to 8 PM MDT this evening. * IMPACTS...Hot temperatures may cause heat illnesses.
info.instruction: Drink plenty of fluids, stay in an air-conditioned room, stay out of the sun, and check up on relatives and neighbors. To reduce risk during outdoor work, the Occupational Safety and Health Administration recommends scheduling frequent rest breaks in shaded or air conditioned environments. Anyone overcome by heat should be moved to a cool and shaded location. Heat stroke is an emergency! Call 9 1 1.
